Culturally Situated Design Tools

Virtual Bead Loom: http://csdt.rpi.edu/na/loom/index.html

Pacific Northwest Basket Weaver: http://csdt.rpi.edu/na/pnwb/weavework.html

Navajo Rug Weaver: http://csdt.rpi.edu/na/rugweaver/index.html

1. Each member of your group will go through your entire cultural background section individually. (Wednesday/Friday)

  • Answer any questions posed in the section in your journal.
  • Look for and write down the mathematical connections.

2. All group members will discuss the section. (Friday)

  • Resolve answers to questions and mathematical connections.

3. Each member of the group completes the tutorial. (Friday)

  • Virtual Bead Loom
  • Pacific NW Basket Weaver
  • Navajo Rug Weaver
  • Go through the tutorial at your own pace, but discuss with other members as questions arise.
  • Record in your journal points that you want to remember.

 4. Groups create designs using the design tool software. (Monday)

  • Each person should choose one of the goal pictures for practice and discuss any issues with the other group members.
  • Groups decide whether they want to create one design as a group or have multiple designs for their presentation
  • Groups work on design/designs – these should be your own creations rather than a mimic of one of the preloaded designs.

5. Edit designs with Photoshop. (Tuesday)

6. Prepare presentations to include: (Tuesday/Wednesday)

  • Culture – an explanation in your own words
  • Math connections – an explanation in your own words
  • Demo of software
  • Display of designs – include a written description of how your created your design

7. Groups deliver presentations (Wednesday)

  • Respond to questions from other students and teacher.
  • What did computer scientists who created the tools need to know?

Project Rubric: CSDT_ProjectRubric

Scavenger Hunt

With your group, find the items in the list: Scavenger Hunt.

Computer Buying Project

You will work in a team of 3-4 to complete the Computer Buying Project.
